paper.title: A Diagram Editor for Line Drawings with Inscriptions
paper.venue: Applications and Theory of Petri Nets
paper.abstract: A major obstacle to the use of diagrams in system design is the time required to draw and edit such diagrams. The primary purpose of the Diagram Editor is to reduce this time. Initial layout is facilitated by a technique that permits rapid visual evaluation of shape, size and positioning alternatives. Editing is supported in the same sense that a word processor supports the preparation of text. Thus a minor change which might normally require hours of mindless work redrawing an entire diagram can be accomplished in minutes.
